Subject: unplanned naturally occurring radiation exposure
Value: exposure to naturally ocurring radioactive material

Subject: mass number
Value: Radon dosimeters are radiation dosimeters used to measure the presence and concentration of radon gas (Rn-222), a radioactive noble gas that can accumulate in buildings and pose health risks. Different types of radon detectors use various detection methods, based on the radioactive decay products of radon.

Subject: mass number
Value: The atomic mass (ma or m) is the mass of an atom.  The protons and neutrons of the nucleus account for nearly all of the total mass of atoms, with the electrons and nuclear binding energy making minor contributions.  It is measured in Daltons (unit).

Subject: radiation response modifier
Value: Radiation response modifiers are agents that alter tumor or normal tissue response to radiation, such as radiation sensitizers and radiation protectors.

Subject: Iron-56 nucleus
Value: An atomic nucleus with 26 protons and 30 neutrons

Subject: Silicon-28 nucleus
Value: An atomic nucleus with 14 protons and 14 neutrons

Subject: Carbon-12 nucleus
Value: An atomic nucleus with 6 protons and 6 neutrons

Subject: Helium-4 nucleus
Value: An atomic nucleus with 2 protons and 2 neutrons

Subject: Neon-20 nucleus
Value: An atomic nucleus with 10 protons and 10 neutrons

Value: An atomic nucleus with 41 protons and 52 neutrons

Value: An atomic nucleus with 47 protons and 60 neutrons

Value: An atomic nucleus with 54 protons and 75 neutrons

Value: An atomic nucleus with 73 protons and 108 neutrons

Subject: Gold-197 nucleus
Value: An atomic nucleus with 79 protons and 118 neutrons

Subject: Nitrogen-14 nucleus
Value: An atomic nucleus with 7 protons and 7 neutrons

Subject: Oxygen-16 nucleus
Value: An atomic nucleus with 8 protons and 8 neutrons

Subject: Argon-40 nucleus
Value: An atomic nucleus with 18 protons and 22 neutrons

Subject: Titanium-48 nucleus
Value: An atomic nucleus with 22 protons and 26 neutrons

Subject: Faxitron CP160
Value: A specific instance of Faxitron CP160 x-ray source.

Subject: X-Rad320
Value: A specific instance of an X-Rad320 x-ray source.

Subject: earth surface radiation environment
Value: The radiation environment at the surface of the Earth, consisting of particles originating in space which are sufficiently energetic and/or weakly interacting with the Earth's magnetic field and atmosphere to reach the surface; particles produced by interactions of space radiation with the Earth's atmosphere; decays of naturally occurring radioactive elements on the surface; and anthropogenic radiation. The composition and strength of the radiation at a given point on the Earth's surface depends on factors including altitude, the composition of the surface material, and the temporal variation in incident space radiation, e.g. with solar cycle.

Subject: external radiation exposure
Value: Mice exposed to external radiation from a Sr source.

Subject: senolytic
Value: A senolytic is a type of drug or compound that selectively induces the death, removal or both of senescent cellsï¿½cells that have stopped dividing but often remain metabolically active, often secreting inflammatory and harmful molecules. These cells accumulate with age and contribute to aging-related diseases, chronic inflammation, and tissue dysfunction.

Subject: spacecraft module
Value: a self-contained unit of a spacecraft

Subject: gamma radiation
Value: electromagnetic radiation with photon energies greater than approximately 100 keV

Subject: earth surface radiation environment
Value: The radiation environment at the surface of the Earth, consisting of particles originating in space which are sufficiently energetic and/or weakly interacting with the Earth's magnetic field and atmosphere to reach the surface; particles produced by interactions of space radiation with the Earth's atmosphere; decays of naturally occurring radioactive elements on the surface; and anthropogenic radiation. The composition and strength of the radiation at a given point on the Earth's surface depends on factors including altitude, the composition of the surface material, and the temporal variation in incident space radiation, e.g. with solar cycle.

Subject: epithermal neutron
Value: a neutron with energy greater than a thermal neutron, but less than a fast neutron. The approximate energy range is 0.025-0.4 eV.
